title: Cannot access GitHub within VPN
content:
Hey team! After my organization restricted GitHub access to a specific IP ranges (from inside company VPN) I cannot access GitHub Organization repositories through Firefox Developer Edition, though VPN works and I am signed in. I can see the following error: `Access forbidden from this IP address` together with incorrect IP address displayed.

Also worth mentioning that through Google Chrome I can access my company GitHub pages perfectly.

Can you please help?
creator: caesarandroidru

title: SEC_ERROR_REUSED_ISSUER_AND_SERIAL en 32 bits pero no en 64 bits en el mismo pc.
content:
Hola, saludos a tod@s

He intentado acceder a https://www.juegosonce.es/ desde la versión de 32 bits del Firefox 111.0.1 y no he podido ya que aparece el error de conexión " SEC_ERROR_REUSED_ISSUER_AND_SERIAL". Sin embargo, en la misma versión de Firefox de 64 bits desde el mismo pc portatil SÍ que puedo acceder con normalidad.

Recuerdo que me pasó lo mismo cuando instalé el antivirus Avira. Lo solucioné colocando una excepción en el apartado servidores del administrador de certificados. Borré la excepción y sigo sin poder acceder. Intenté colocar la excepción de nuevo por probar algo y no me dejó, no podía obtener el certificado desde https://www.juegosonce.es/

A ver si alguien da con el error.

Eso es todo, muchas gracias.
creator: ferdv77

creator: anupad18

title: Using Different Search Engines for Address Bar & Search Bar?
content:
Is there a way to customize settings so that my address bar uses one search engine and my search bar uses another? For instance, can I set my browser so that when I type something into the address bar it will using the Yahoo! Search engine, but if I type something into the Search Bar next to it that the Search Bar uses Google Search?

I doubt this is an option the browser offers, but thought I'd ask to be sure.
creator: FireFoxFan1

title: Firefox not handling the response headers
content:
Hi, I have been working on a old project for one of my clients and found an issue. The firefox version i am using is 95.0.1 64bit version. After signing in, inside response headers from the server i am getting

set-cookie MYSESSION=eyJ***** HttpOnly

which is then used on next request i make to the server as Cookie MYSESSION=eyJhb***

But after upgrading my firefox version, although i am able to see the response header sent back from server, but it is not being sent in request header for the next api call.

Also this issue is only for localhost, works fine in production https urls

I would like to know what has changed in new version in terms of handling the response headers, thanks!
creator: ratnabh2614

title: unable to proceed with myGov.au procedures. Following their directions after filling in data, leads to blanks. On Chrome, the next procedure ensues.

title: Youtube Chapters Hard to Read in Firefox
content:
I've been noticing for a while that Youtube chapters were very hard to read if they were displaying over a white background. I thought this was just a Youtube issue but then I decided to boot up Edge and Brave to see if the issue still persisted. It doesn't. What happens in those browsers is that there is that the bottom part of the video is darkened just enough so that when the chapters are displayed there is enough contrast to read them. In Firefox this overlay cuts out before it reaches the chapters making them very difficult to read. I tried in Troubleshoot Mode and the issue persists.

I've linked pictures that demonstrate the difference.
creator: MonsieurJambon

title: you tube skipping and slow playback when using autocad LT
content:
I watch a live stream from back in the UK from talkSPORT daily. Lately I noticed that my video rate was too low and the play back was skipping and stopping. I run a 64gb Nvidia graphic card so it cant be that.

I normally run firefox and it's always the latest release. Today I tried it out on Chore and I had zero issues withe playback.

I can only come to the conclusion that firefox has cocked summat up. This is only been happening for the past past month or two.

I don't know if it's anything to due with Nvidia software or not but it needs to be sorted out. I've been using firefox since it started. I'm used to the ecosystem. I don't want to have to adjust to chrome.
creator: kakashi
